instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, no chime or boot, fan spin!!!
threads.message:
i have 2 exactly same
board , both had slight water damage , all clean now,
both <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board, now fan spin , does not boot,

<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0</SIGNAL>= 1.12v, fan spin perfectly

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, no chime or boot, fan spin!!!
threads.message: Liquid damage where? Beeps without RAM, 4 pin case speaker connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, no chime or boot, fan spin!!!
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 32720"]Liquid damage where? Beeps without RAM, 4 pin case speaker connected.[/QUOTE]

no sounds if i take our ram , also when fan start, hard drive white  led iin front of laptop keep on

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, no chime or boot, fan spin!!!
threads.message: Could be anything. Crap under SMC/PCH, dead clock chip are the most common. All depends on where the corrosion was.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, no chime or boot, fan spin!!!
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 32775"]Could be anything. Crap under SMC/PCH, dead clock chip are the most common. All depends on where the corrosion was.[/QUOTE]

which one is clock chip , liqued damage was around led drive and that end all the way to fan ,

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, no chime or boot, fan spin!!!
threads.message: Clock chip is <CHIP>U2600</CHIP>. Corrosion under the SMC or PCH will be the most likely cause of this though.
